sen.j: 清酒酵母（せいしゅこうぼ）とは、日本酒醸造に用いられる酵母の総称。
sen.e: Sake yeast is the generic term referring to yeasts used for brewing sake (Japanese liquor).
Sake yeast is the generic term referring to yeasts used for brewing sake (Japanese liquor).
Sake yeast is the generic term referring to yeasts used for brewing sake (Japanese liquor).

sen.j: 清酒の香味を大きく左右する要因の一つ。
sen.e: It is one of the factors that greatly affect the flavor and aroma of sake.
It is one of the factors that greatly affect the flavor and aroma of sake.
It is one of the factors that greatly affect the flavor and aroma of sake.

sen.j: 種としてはほとんどが出芽酵母 Saccharomyces cerevisiaeで、中でも特に醸造特性の高い株が選抜して用いられることが多い。
sen.e: Most of the yeasts are classified under Saccharomyces cerevisiae, among which strains with a particularly high brewing quality are selected for use.
Most of the yeasts are classified under budding yeast (Saccharomyces cerevisiae), among which strains with a particularly high brewing quality are selected for use.
sen.cmt: 用語集から、budding yeastを追加しました。
sen.e: Most of the yeasts are classified under budding yeast (Saccharomyces cerevisiae), among which strains with a particularly high brewing quality are selected for use.

sen.j: また、必ずしも単一の株だけが用いられるわけではなく、日本酒酒母造りを混合したり、出来上がった酒をブレンドするなどの手法でそれぞれの株の長所を組み合わせた形で用いられることも多い。
sen.e: Instead of using just one kind of strain, sake is usually made from a blend of sake yeast mashes, or by blending finished sake liquors, thus combining the merits of each strain.
Instead of using just one kind of strain, sake is usually made from a blend of sake yeast mashes, or by blending finished sake liquors, thus combining the merits of each strain.
Instead of using just one kind of strain, sake is usually made from a blend of sake yeast mashes, or by blending finished sake liquors, thus combining the merits of each strain.

sen.j: ちなみに、現在 Saccharomyces cerevisiaeに分類されている酵母でも、その分類に異論を唱える専門家もいる。
sen.e: For information, some experts dispute about yeasts that have already been classified under Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
For your information, some experts dispute about yeasts that have already been classified under Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
For your information, some experts dispute about yeasts that have already been classified under Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

sen.j: 清酒酵母には醸造中に協会系酵母泡あり酵母と呼ばれる大量の泡を発生させる協会系酵母泡あり酵母と、高泡を発生しない協会系酵母泡なし酵母とがあり、後者の方が生産性が高い。
sen.e: Sake yeasts comprise foaming Kyokai sake yeasts, which are high producers of foam, and non-foaming Kyokai sake yeasts, which are low producers of foam, the latter of which having a higher productivity.
sen.cmt: 協会系酵母泡あり酵母、協会系酵母泡なし酵母：いずれも協会系酵母で一度切れると思われます。
sen.e: Sake yeasts comprise foam-forming kyokai sake yeasts, which are high producers of foam, and non-forming kyokai sake yeasts, which are low producers of foam, the latter of which having a higher productivity.
sen.cmt: 用語集に統一しました。
sen.e: Sake yeasts comprise foam-forming kyokai sake yeasts, which are high producers of foam, and non-forming kyokai sake yeasts, which are low producers of foam, the latter of which having a higher productivity.

sen.j: 日本醸造協会や地方自治体の試験研究施設から頒布されるほか、大学や各醸造所が独自に分離・培養するものもある。
sen.e: They are distributed by laboratories or research institutes of Brewing Society of Japan or local municipalities, or isolated/cultured by colleges or breweries on their own.

Sake yeasts are distributed by laboratories or research institutes of Brewing Society of Japan or local municipalities, in addition, some universities and breweries isolate and culture them on their own.
sen.cmt: 後半を再整理しました。
sen.e: Sake yeasts are distributed by laboratories or research institutes of Brewing Society of Japan or local municipalities, in addition, some universities and breweries isolate and culture them on their own.

sen.j: 頒布形態としては協会系酵母、協会系酵母、協会系酵母乾燥酵母などがある。
sen.e: Sake yeasts are distributed in the form of Kyokai sake yeasts, Kyokai sake yeasts, or dried yeasts.
sen.cmt: 原文は、「頒布形態としては協会系酵母、協会系酵母、協会系酵母乾燥酵母などがある。」となっており、2つ同じものが羅列されていますが、ウィキペディアのサイトでは「頒布形態としてはアンプル、スラント、乾燥酵母などがある(...in the form of an ampule, slant or dried yeast)」となっています。仕様書に従い、あえてそのまま訳出しています。
sen.e: Sake yeasts are distributed in the forms of Kyokai sake yeasts, Kyokai sake yeasts, Kyokai sake yeasts, or dried yeasts.
Sake yeasts are distributed in the forms of Kyokai sake yeasts, Kyokai sake yeasts, Kyokai sake yeasts, or dried yeasts.

sen.j: 乾燥酵母では日本酒酒母が不要となる。
sen.e: When using dried yeasts, shubo (yeast mash) is unnecessary.
When using dried yeasts, shubo (yeast mash) is unnecessary.
When using dried yeasts, shubo (yeast mash) is unnecessary.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 前近代
sen.e: Premodern times
Premodern times
Premodern times

sen.j: 日本酒は、自然界に存在する酵母を、おそらく初めは偶然にとりこんで造られた。
sen.e: Presumably, sake was first made by taking in naturally residing yeasts accidentally.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Presumably, sake was first made by taking in naturally residing yeasts accidentally.
Presumably, sake was first made by taking in naturally residing yeasts accidentally.

sen.j: また以後は伝承技法に基づいたり、ずっと醸造所に住みついている「蔵つき酵母」「家つき酵母」を用いたりして造られてきたが、それでは酒質が安定せず、良い酒ができても「まったく同じものをまたつくる」ということができなかった。
sen.e: Later, it was made by applying traditional techniques, or using 'Kuratsuki kobo' or 'Ietsuki kobo' (endemic house yeasts), but there was variation in sake quality, and, even when good sake was obtained, 'reproducing exactly the same one' wasn't attainable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, it was made by applying traditional techniques, or using 'Kuratsuki kobo' or 'Ietsuki kobo' (yeasts living in the brewery), however it was hard to stabilize the sake quality, and, even when good sake was produced, 'reproducing exactly the same one' wasn't attainable.
sen.cmt: (endemic house yeasts) → (yeasts living in the brewery)but there was variation in sake quality → however it was hard to stabilize the sake quality
sen.e: Later, it was made by applying traditional techniques, or using 'Kuratsuki kobo' or 'Ietsuki kobo' (yeasts living in the brewery), however it was hard to stabilize the sake quality, and, even when good sake was produced, 'reproducing exactly the same one' wasn't attainable.

sen.j: 科学的再現性が大問題だったわけである。
sen.e: The scientific reproducibility was a major problem.
The scientific reproducibility was a major problem.
The scientific reproducibility was a major problem.

sen.j: しかし古来においても、今のような「発酵」という言葉こそなかったとはいえ、米と水に「あるもの」を加えると酒に変わることはしっかりと認識されており、その「あるもの」を麹（こうじ）、酛（もと）、または酒母（もと / しゅぼ）と呼んでいたわけである。
sen.e: Even in ancient times, when the modern term 'fermentation' didn't exist, it was well known that adding 'something' to rice and water will turn the mixture into sake, and this 'something' was called koji, moto, or shubo.

Even in ancient times, when the modern term 'fermentation' didn't exist, it was well known that adding 'something' to rice and water will turn the mixture into sake, and this 'something' was called koji (malted rice), moto (yeast mash), or shubo.
sen.cmt: 用語集からカッコ内を補足しました。
sen.e: Even in ancient times, when the modern term 'fermentation' didn't exist, it was well known that adding 'something' to rice and water will turn the mixture into sake, and this 'something' was called koji (malted rice), moto (yeast mash), or shubo.

sen.j: 同じ並行複発酵の酒文化圏である中国では、序文が1117年に書かれたことがわかっている醸造技術書『北山酒経』によれば、すでに宋 (王朝)の時代に「酵」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: In China, which belongs to the same liquor culture region of multiple parallel fermentation, fermentation was already called 'Ko' in the age of the Sung dynasty, according to a brewing treatise titled "Hokuzan Shukei" (book on brewing technique), the preface of which is known to be written in 1117.

In China, which belongs to the same liquor culture region of multiple parallel fermentation, fermentation was already called 'Ko' in the age of the Sung dynasty, according to a brewing treatise titled "Hokuzan Shukei" (book on brewing technique), the preface of which is known to be written in 1117.

In China, which belongs to the same liquor culture region of multiple parallel fermentation, fermentation was already called 'Ko' in the age of the Sung dynasty, according to a brewing treatise titled "Hokuzan Shukei" (book on brewing technique), the preface of which is known to be written in 1117.

sen.j: 近代
sen.e: Modern times
Modern times
Modern times

sen.j: 「あるもの」を加えなくても原料が酒に変化する単発酵の酒文化圏である西洋においては、酵母の存在が科学的に認識されたのは19世紀に入ってからのことであった。
sen.e: In the West that belongs to the liquor culture region of single-fermentation where ingredients turn into liquor without adding 'something,' the existence of yeasts was scientifically proven only in the 19th century.

In the West that belongs to the liquor culture region of single-fermentation where ingredients turn into liquor without adding 'something,' the existence of yeasts was scientifically proven only in the 19th century.

In the West that belongs to the liquor culture region of single-fermentation where ingredients turn into liquor without adding 'something,' the existence of yeasts was scientifically proven only in the 19th century.

sen.j: 清酒酵母のみならず、ビール酵母、ワイン酵母、パン酵母も含まれる出芽酵母Saccharomyces cerevisiaeは、1830年代にJ. Meyenが発見し、1882年ごろE.C. Hansenによって命名されたため、Saccharomyces cerevisiae Meyen ex Hansen と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Because Saccharomyces cerevisiae, that comprises not only sake yeasts but also beer yeasts, wine yeasts and bread yeasts, was discovered by J. Meyen in the 1830th, and named as such by E.C. Hansen around 1882, it is also referred to as Saccharomyces cerevisiae Meyen ex Hansen.

Because Saccharomyces cerevisiae, that comprises not only sake yeasts but also beer yeasts, wine yeasts and bread yeasts, was discovered by J. Meyen in the 1830's, and named as such by E.C. Hansen around 1882, it is also referred to as Saccharomyces cerevisiae Meyen ex Hansen.

Because Saccharomyces cerevisiae, that comprises not only sake yeasts but also beer yeasts, wine yeasts and bread yeasts, was discovered by J. Meyen in the 1830's, and named as such by E.C. Hansen around 1882, it is also referred to as Saccharomyces cerevisiae Meyen ex Hansen.

sen.j: 日本にこれら近代醸造学が導入されたのは、明治になってからであるが、初めは日本酒のためではなくビールの醸造技術を学ぶ過程で、「発酵をうながす微生物」として英語yeastやドイツ語Hefeが語彙として入ってきた。
sen.e: Modern brewing techniques were introduced to Japan in the Meiji period, on which occasion an English word yeast and a German word Hefe were imported to refer to 'microorganisms that promote fermentation' in the course of studying beer brewing techniques instead of sake brewing techniques.

Modern brewing techniques were introduced to Japan in the Meiji period, on which occasion an English word yeast and a German word Hefe were imported to refer to 'microorganisms that promote fermentation' in the course of studying beer brewing techniques instead of sake brewing techniques.

Modern brewing techniques were introduced to Japan in the Meiji period, on which occasion an English word yeast and a German word Hefe were imported to refer to 'microorganisms that promote fermentation' in the course of studying beer brewing techniques instead of sake brewing techniques.

sen.j: 明治6年（1874年）には、H.カリーベールド著 小泉晴江訳『科学捷径 酒水製造書 全』のなかで、「醗酷」が「はっこう」「ヤアスト」 というふりがな付きで酵母の意味として使われている。
sen.e: In 1874, '醗酷' accompanied by its readings 'hakko' and 'yasuto,' which means yeast, appeared in "Kagaku Shokei Shusui Seizo-sho Zen" (scientific expedient of sake brewing) written by H.カリ-ベ-ルド and translated by Harue Koizumi.
sen.cmt: 醗酷：この表記そのものが話題になっています。H.カリーベールド：ヘンリー・カリーベールドのようですがスペルが不明なのでそのままとします。Kaliberdという名はあるようですが、同一であるか確認できません。
sen.e: In 1874, '醗酷' accompanied by its readings 'hakko' and 'yasuto,' which means yeast, appeared in "Kagaku Shokei Shusui Seizo-sho Zen" (scientific expedient of sake brewing) written by H.カリ-ベ-ルド and translated by Harue Koizumi.

In 1874, '醗酷' accompanied by its readings 'hakko' and 'yasuto,' which means yeast, appeared in "Kagaku Shokei Shusui Seizo-sho Zen" (scientific expedient of sake brewing) written by H. Caliberd and translated by Harue Koizumi.
sen.cmt: H.カリーベールドのスペル をCaliberdとしました。

sen.j: 「ヤアスト」とはyeast、今ふうに表音すればイーストのことである。
sen.e: Yasuto' is what we call yeast today.
Yasuto' is what we call yeast today.
Yasuto' is what we call yeast today.

sen.j: 明治20年（1888年）刊行の書物では､学名Saccharomyces cerevisiaeを表音して「サッカロミセス・セレウヰシェー」、「この菌は酒類の醸造およびパンの製造に用ゆ」とされている。
sen.e: In a book published in 1888, the scientific name Saccharomyces cerevisiae was phonetically written as 'サッカロミセス・セレウヰシェ-,' and explained as 'microorganisms used for brewing liquor or making bread.'
sen.cmt: サッカロミセス・セレウヰシェー：カタカナによる表音表記そのものが取りざたされています。
sen.e: In a book published in 1888, the scientific name Saccharomyces cerevisiae was phonetically written as 'サッカロミセス・セレウヰシェ-,' and explained as 'microorganisms used for brewing liquor or making bread.'
In a book published in 1888, the scientific name Saccharomyces cerevisiae was phonetically written as 'サッカロミセス・セレウヰシェ-,' and explained as 'microorganisms used for brewing liquor or making bread.'

sen.j: 日本醸造協会の資料ページによれば、「酵母」「清酒発酵母」という翻訳語が初めて醸造雑誌に見られるようになるのは明治21年（1889年）～22年にかけてであったが、その後しばらくは「酵母」「清酒酵母」「醸母」「醸母菌」「イースト」などさまざまな呼称で表現されていた。
sen.e: According to the reference offered by Brewing Society of Japan, translations such as '酵母(yeast)' or '清酒発酵母 (sake yeast)' first appeared in brewery magazines from 1889 to 1890, which were described variously as '酵母,' '清酒酵母,' '醸母,' '醸母菌,' or 'イ-スト' for some time.
sen.cmt: 「酵母」「清酒酵母」「醸母」「醸母菌」「イースト」：表記そのものが取りざたされています。これらは英訳した場合、いずれも(sake) yeastとなってしまいます。
sen.e: According to the reference offered by Brewing Society of Japan, translations such as '酵母(yeast)' or '清酒発酵母 (sake yeast)' first appeared in brewery magazines in the period during 1889 to 1890, which were described variously as '酵母,' '清酒酵母,' '醸母,' '醸母菌,' or 'イ-スト' for some time.

According to the reference offered by Brewing Society of Japan, translations such as '酵母(yeast)' or '清酒発酵母 (sake yeast)' first appeared in brewery magazines in the period during 1889 to 1890, which were described variously as '酵母,' '清酒酵母,' '醸母,' '醸母菌,' or 'イ-スト' for some time.

sen.j: この時期こそ、じつは日本が近代醸造学の基礎を確立しようと奮闘していた時期でもあったといえる。
sen.e: In fact, it was during that period that Japan was struggling to form foundations for modern zymurgy.
In fact, it was during that period that Japan was struggling to form foundations for modern zymurgy.
In fact, it was during that period that Japan was struggling to form foundations for modern zymurgy.

sen.j: 1893年には日本人の醸造学者矢部規矩治（やべ・きくじ）博士によって、日本酒の日本酒醪（もろみ）から清酒酵母が分離された。
sen.e: In 1893, Dr. Kikuji YABE, who was a Japanese zymologist, isolated sake yeast from Nihonshu moromi (final mash) of sake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1893, Dr. Kikuji YABE, who was a Japanese zymologist, isolated sake yeast from Nihonshu moromi (raw unrefined sake) of sake.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて(final mash) → (raw unrefined sake)としました。
sen.e: In 1893, Dr. Kikuji YABE, who was a Japanese zymologist, isolated sake yeast from Nihonshu moromi (raw unrefined sake) of sake.

sen.j: 1895年にはそれに彼の名前を冠し、国際学会でそれがSaccharomyces sake Yabeとして発表された。
sen.e: In 1895, it was named after the zymologist and presented at an international symposium as Saccharomyces sake Yabe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1895, it was named after the zymologist and presented at an international symposium as Saccharomyces sake Yabe.
In 1895, it was named after the zymologist and presented at an international symposium as Saccharomyces sake Yabe.

sen.j: また明治37年（1904年）には大蔵省の管轄下に国立醸造試験所が設立された。
sen.e: In 1904, the National Research Institute of Brewing was established under the Ministry of Finance.
In 1904, the National Research Institute of Brewing was established under the Ministry of Finance.
In 1904, the National Research Institute of Brewing was established under the Ministry of Finance.

sen.j: これが現在の独立行政法人酒類総合研究所となる。
sen.e: This is the forerunner of the present-day National Research Institute of Brewing (NRIB).
This is the forerunner of the present-day National Research Institute of Brewing (NRIB).
This is the forerunner of the present-day National Research Institute of Brewing (NRIB).

sen.j: こうした中でそれまで多様に訳されていたyeast, Hafeが、明治37年（1905年）～38年ごろには「酵母｣という訳語に統一されていったという。
sen.e: Over the course described above, various translations for yeast or Hafe were unified as '酵母.'
Over the course described above, various translations for yeast or Hafe were unified as '酵母.'
Over the course described above, various translations for yeast or Hafe were unified as '酵母.'

sen.j: この訳語を考案した人は年現在定かではないが、「酵」は古くから東洋で発酵現象を意味する字であり、「母」は、それ以前も「酒母」と書いて「もと」と読んでいたことも含めて、万物の根源、現象の元、という意味の字であったからだと考えられる。
sen.e: Although the person who coined the translation is unknown as of year, it was presumably named as such taking into account the fact that '酵' had long been a letter meaning fermentation in Asia, and '母,' which had also been written as '酒母' and read as 'moto (origin),' had been a letter meaning an origin of all creation or phenomena.
sen.cmt: 考案した人は年現在定かではない：以下のwikipediaサイトでは、「考案した人は2010年現在定かではない」となっていますが、仕様書に従いあえてそのまま訳出しています。従って文章は未完です。
sen.e: Although the person who coined the translation is unknown as of year, it was presumably named as such because of the fact that '酵' had long been a letter meaning fermentation in Asia, and '母,' which had also been written as '酒母' and read as 'moto (origin),' had been a letter meaning an origin of all creation or phenomena.

Although the person who coined the translation is unknown as of year, it was presumably named as such because of the fact that '酵' had long been a letter meaning fermentation in Asia, and '母,' which had also been written as '酒母' and read as 'moto (origin),' had been a letter meaning an origin of all creation or phenomena.

sen.j: その後も国立醸造試験所では明治42年（1909年）山廃仕込みが開発され、翌年（1910年）には日本酒速醸系（そくじょうけい）が考案され、さらに明治44年（1911年）には第一回全国新酒鑑評会が開催されることになる。
sen.e: Later, Yamahai-jikomi (a method of yeast-mash making) was developed in 1909, Sokujo-kei (quick fermentation method) for sake was developed the next year (1910), and the first Zenkoku Shinshu Kanpyokai (National New Sake Appraising and Deliberating Fair) was held in 1911.

Later, Yamahai-jikomi (a method of yeast-mash making) was developed in 1909, Sokujo-kei (seed mash made by the quick fermentation method) for sake was developed in the next year (1910), and the first Zenkoku Shinshu Kanpyokai (National New Sake Appraising and Deliberating Fair) was held in 1911.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせて(quick fermentation method) → (seed mash made by the quick fermentation method)としました。inを追加しました。
sen.e: Later, Yamahai-jikomi (a method of yeast-mash making) was developed in 1909, Sokujo-kei (seed mash made by the quick fermentation method) for sake was developed in the next year (1910), and the first Zenkoku Shinshu Kanpyokai (National New Sake Appraising and Deliberating Fair) was held in 1911.

sen.j: ここで高い順位を取るなどして客観的に優秀と評価された酵母を、醸造協会（現在の日本醸造協会）が分離、純粋培養し、全国の酒蔵に頒布するというシステムがやがて整えられていった。
sen.e: Over time, a system for Brewing Society (present-day Brewing Society of Japan) to isolate, pure-culture, and distribute the high-prize winning yeasts that were objectively evaluated as excellent at the fair to breweries throughout Japan was established.

Over time, a system for Brewing Society (present-day Brewing Society of Japan) to isolate, pure-culture, and distribute the high-prize winning yeasts that were objectively evaluated as excellent at the fair to breweries throughout Japan was established.

Over time, a system for Brewing Society (present-day Brewing Society of Japan) to isolate, pure-culture, and distribute the high-prize winning yeasts that were objectively evaluated as excellent at the fair to breweries throughout Japan was established.

sen.j: このような酵母が今日の協会系酵母である。
sen.e: Such yeasts are called Kyokai sake yeasts today.
Such yeasts are called Kyokai sake yeasts today.
Such yeasts are called Kyokai sake yeasts today.

sen.j: 現代
sen.e: Present day
sen.cmt: 近代がすでに登場し、modern timesと表現していますので、present dayとして差別化しています。
sen.e: Present day
Present day

sen.j: 大正時代から昭和時代初頭、1920年代には、国立醸造研究所を中心として、さらに高度な品質の日本酒の開発が模索され、そうした中でのちに日本酒吟醸酒の誕生として普及する酒の原形を醸造する清酒酵母が造られ始めた。
sen.e: From the Taisho period through the early Showa period to the 1920th, the National Institute of Brewing conducted researches for higher quality sake, and during the course production of sake yeasts for making primary types of sake which were later developed and spread as Nihonshu ginjo-shu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less) began.
sen.cmt: 国立醸造研究所：定訳が不明です。
sen.e: In the 1920's, from the Taisho period through the early Showa period, the National Institute of Brewing conducted researches for higher quality sake, and during the course production of sake yeasts for making archetypes of sake which were later developed and spread as Nihonshu ginjo-shu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less) began.

In the 1920's, from the Taisho period through the early Showa period, the National Institute of Brewing conducted researches for higher quality sake, and during the course production of sake yeasts for making archetypes of sake which were later developed and spread as Nihonshu ginjo-shu (high-quality sake brewed at low temperatures from rice grains milled to 60 % weight or less) began.

sen.j: 吟醸酒の実現には酵母のみならず、精米技術の向上など多方面の研究を待たなければならなかったが、やがて1970年代には、日本酒醪（もろみ）造りの工程における温度管理の技術が飛躍的に発達し、協会系酵母協会7号や協会系酵母協会9号などの新しい酵母が実用化され、日本酒吟醸酒・純米吟醸酒などが出荷されはじめた。
sen.e: Although making of ginjo-shu required improvement in rice polishing and other technologies in various fields in addition to yeasts, the 1970th saw a breakthrough in temperature control technology in the Nihonshu moromi-zukuri (preparation of final mash) process, bringing new yeasts such as Sake yeast kyokai No.7 and Sake yeast kyokai No.9 into actual use, and delivery of Nihonshu ginjo-shu and junmai (sake brewed with only rice, water, and koji without additives) ginjo-shu was started.

In order to produce ginjo-shu, improvements in various fields such as rice polishing and other technologies in addition to yeasts are required, and then in the 1970's, a breakthrough in temperature control technology in the Nihonshu moromi-zukuri (preparation of final mash) process and realization of new yeasts such as Sake yeast kyokai No.7 and Sake yeast kyokai No.9 enabled brewers to produce Nihonshu ginjo-shu and junmai (sake brewed with only rice, water, and koji without additives) ginjo-shu.

In order to produce ginjo-shu, improvements in various fields such as rice polishing and other technologies in addition to yeasts are required, and then in the 1970's, a breakthrough in temperature control technology in the Nihonshu moromi-zukuri (preparation of final mash) process and realization of new yeasts such as Sake yeast kyokai No.7 and Sake yeast kyokai No.9 enabled brewers to produce Nihonshu ginjo-shu and junmai (sake brewed with only rice, water, and koji without additives) ginjo-shu.

sen.j: 1980年代以降の吟醸酒ブームを受けて、さらに少酸性酵母、高エステル生成酵母、リンゴ酸高生産性多酸酵母といった高い香りを出す酵母が多数つくられ、都道府県の管轄下にある研究センターや農業大学を中心として新たな酵母の開発が進んだ。
sen.e: In response to the ginjo-shu boom in the 1980th and after, many yeasts that yield a high aroma, such as low-acid-producing yeasts, high-ester-producing yeasts, and high-malic-acid-producing yeasts, were developed, and research institutes under prefectural governments and agricultural colleges promoted development of new types of yeasts.

In response to the ginjo-shu boom in the 1980's and later, many yeasts that yield a high aroma, such as low-acid-producing yeasts, high-ester-producing yeasts, and high-malic-acid-producing yeasts, were developed, and research institutes under prefectural governments and agricultural colleges promoted development of new types of yeasts.

In response to the ginjo-shu boom in the 1980's and later, many yeasts that yield a high aroma, such as low-acid-producing yeasts, high-ester-producing yeasts, and high-malic-acid-producing yeasts, were developed, and research institutes under prefectural governments and agricultural colleges promoted development of new types of yeasts.

sen.j: 本ページ「地方自治体開発の酵母」「大学で開発された酵母」「企業・民間機関開発の酵母」などがそれにあたる。
sen.e: These are explained in 'Yeasts developed by local municipalities,' 'Yeasts developed by colleges,' and 'Yeasts developed by companies and private institutes' in this section.
These are explained in 'Yeasts developed by local municipalities,' 'Yeasts developed by colleges,' and 'Yeasts developed by companies and private institutes' in this section.
These are explained in 'Yeasts developed by local municipalities,' 'Yeasts developed by colleges,' and 'Yeasts developed by companies and private institutes' in this section.

sen.j: 特徴
sen.e: Characteristics
Characteristics
Characteristics

sen.j: きょうかい酵母
sen.e: Kyokai kobo (Kyokai yeast)
Kyokai kobo (Kyokai yeast)
Kyokai kobo (Kyokai yeast)

sen.j: 日本醸造協会によって頒布される酵母。
sen.e: Yeasts distributed by the Brewing Society of Japan
Yeasts distributed by the Brewing Society of Japan
Yeasts distributed by the Brewing Society of Japan

sen.j: 詳しくは協会系酵母を参照。
sen.e: Refer to Kyokai-kei kobo (Kyokai sake yeast) for detail.
Refer to Kyokai-kei kobo (Kyokai sake yeast) for detail.
Refer to Kyokai-kei kobo (Kyokai sake yeast) for detail.

sen.j: 地方自治体開発の酵母
sen.e: Yeasts developed by local municipalities
Yeasts developed by local municipalities
Yeasts developed by local municipalities

sen.j: 地方自治体の試験研究機関、すなわち工業技術センターや醸造試験所などで開発された酵母をいう。
sen.e: Yeasts developed by laboratories and research institutes under local municipalities, such as industrial technology centers and brewing laboratories.
Yeasts developed by laboratories and research institutes under local municipalities, such as industrial technology centers and brewing laboratories.
Yeasts developed by laboratories and research institutes under local municipalities, such as industrial technology centers and brewing laboratories.

sen.j: 気候や土壌を初めとした、それぞれの地方の自然条件を生かすように開発された「酒米地方自治体開発の酒米」を原料として日本酒を醸造するときに、もっとも清酒酵母としての力が発揮されるように、開発の段階から想定もしくは理想としている場合がほとんどである。
sen.e: In most cases, sake yeasts are designed to make the best of them from their development phase, taking into account the sake brewing using 'sakamai (rice for brewing sake) developed by each local municipality in sakamai producing areas,' taking advantage of local natural conditions including climate and soil.

In most cases, sake yeasts are designed to make the best of them from their development phase, taking into account the sake brewing using 'sakamai (rice for brewing sake) developed by each local municipality in sakamai producing areas,' taking advantage of local natural conditions including climate and soil.

In most cases, sake yeasts are designed to make the best of them from their development phase, taking into account the sake brewing using 'sakamai (rice for brewing sake) developed by each local municipality in sakamai producing areas,' taking advantage of local natural conditions including climate and soil.

sen.j: 地産地消が求められる中、酒米とともに、優良酵母の開発は地方自治体にとって地元産清酒の品質向上の、また地場産業建て直しの重要な鍵を握っているといえる。
sen.e: Amid the trend for local consumption of locally produced products, development of superior yeasts along with sakamai is the key factor for local municipalities in the improvement of the local sake quality and recovery of local industries.

Amid the trend for local consumption of locally produced products, development of superior yeasts along with sakamai is the key factor for local municipalities to improve the local sake quality and reconstruct the local industries.
sen.cmt: in the improvement of the local sake quality and recovery of local industries → to improve the local sake quality and reconstruct the local industries.
sen.e: Amid the trend for local consumption of locally produced products, development of superior yeasts along with sakamai is the key factor for local municipalities to improve the local sake quality and reconstruct the local industries.

sen.j: このため、酵母開発の競争は激化しており、今や地方自治体開発の酵母を持たない都道府県の方が少ない状態になっている。
sen.e: These backgrounds have intensified competition for yeast development to the extent that there are fewer prefectures that do not have any municipally developed yeasts today.
These backgrounds have intensified competition for yeast development to the extent that there are fewer prefectures that do not have any municipally developed yeasts today.
These backgrounds have intensified competition for yeast development to the extent that there are fewer prefectures that do not have any municipally developed yeasts today.

sen.j: ただし、開発された酵母は必ずしも各県内のみに流通するのではなく、他県で使用されたり、きょうかい酵母として採用されることもある。
sen.e: However, those locally developed yeasts go beyond the distribution within each prefecture and are used in other prefectures or adopted as a Kyokai yeast.
However, those locally developed yeasts are not necessarily confined within the prefecture, but some of them are used in other prefectures or adopted as a Kyokai yeast.
sen.cmt: go beyond the distribution within each prefectureでは意味が伝わらないと思いますので、are not necessariry confined within the prefecture, but some of themとしました。
sen.e: However, those locally developed yeasts are not necessarily confined within the prefecture, but some of them are used in other prefectures or adopted as a Kyokai yeast.

sen.j: また、他の酵母と交配して、その地方内外のための新たな酵母を開発するための親株となることも多い。
sen.e: Also, they are often used as a parent strain to be bred with other yeasts to develop new yeasts used in and out of the region.
Also, they are often used as a parent strain to be bred with other yeasts to develop new yeasts used in and out of the region.
Also, they are often used as a parent strain to be bred with other yeasts to develop new yeasts used in and out of the region.

sen.e: A high caproic-acid-ethyl-producing yeast which is a cerulenin-resistant mutant strain derived from Mahoroba Hana yeast.
A high caproic-acid-ethyl-producing yeast which is a cerulenin-resistant mutant strain derived from Mahoroba Hana yeast.

sen.j: 県内産米である華想いを用いた大吟醸酒用。

Used for daiginjo-shu (super high-quality sake brewed from rice grains polished to 50 percent weight or less) made from Hanaomoi, which is a rice brand grown in the prefecture.

sen.j: この他、まほろば華酵母のトリフルオロロイシン（ロイシンアナログ (化学)）耐性株である酢酸イソアミル高生産性酵母の開発が進んでいる。
sen.e: Another yeast under development is a high isoamyl-acetate-producing yeast, which is a trifluoroleucine (leucine analog)-resistant strain derived from Mahoroba Hana yeast.

sen.j: これを使用した平成2醸造年度の全国新酒鑑評会では秋田県の金賞受賞数が全国2位となった。
sen.e: At Zenkoku Shinshu Kanpyokai (National New Sake Appraising and Deliberating Fair) held in the brewing year 1990, on which occasion Akita Prefecture sent sake using the yeast, the prefecture won the second largest number of gold prizes in the nation.

sen.j: 平成8年（1996年）より協会系酵母協会1501号として頒布されている。
sen.e: It has been distributed as Sake yeast kyokai No. 1501 since 1996.
It has been distributed as Sake yeast kyokai No. 1501 since 1996.
It has been distributed as Sake yeast kyokai No. 1501 since 1996.

sen.j: カプロン酸エチル高生産性で、低温で発酵が旺盛で日本酒香りが高く、酸の生成が少ない。
sen.e: It produces high ethyl caproate, shows good fermentation at a low temperature, has a high sake aroma, and produces low acid.
It produces high ethyl caproate, shows good fermentation at a low temperature, has a high sake aroma, and produces low acid.
It produces high ethyl caproate, shows good fermentation at a low temperature, has a high sake aroma, and produces low acid.

sen.j: 大吟醸酒、純米大吟醸酒用。
sen.e: It is used for daiginjo-shu and junmai daiginjo-shu.

sen.j: 香りは穏やかで酸の生成が極めて少なく後味が軽い旨口タイプ。
sen.e: It produces a tasty sake, with a mild aroma, minimal acid, and light finish.
It produces tasty sake, with a mild aroma, minimal acid, and light finish.

sen.j: 泡あり酵母。

sen.j: 香りは穏やかで酸の生成が極めて少なく後味が軽い淡麗タイプ。
sen.e: It produces tanrei (crispy and dry) sake, with a mild aroma, minimal acid, and light finish.

sen.j: AK-3Fの泡なし変異株で、性質はAK-3Fに準じアミノ酸の生成が少ない。
sen.e: It is a non-foaming mutant strain derived from AK-3F, and has characteristics similar to AK-3F, producing little amino acid.

sen.j: 平成10年（1998年）開発。
sen.e: Developed in 1998.
Developed in 1998.

sen.j: 低濃度酒用の泡なし酵母。
sen.e: It is a non-foaming yeast for low-alcohol sake.

sen.j: 華やかな果実様の日本酒香りがある。
sen.e: It has a glamorous and fruity sake aroma.

sen.j: こまち酵母
sen.e: Komachi yeast
Komachi yeast
Komachi yeast

sen.j: 平成15年（2003年）開発。
sen.e: Developed in 2003.
Developed in 2003.
Developed in 2003.

sen.j: 全国で使用されている吟醸酒用酵母6株から分離・交雑育種された株を選抜。
sen.e: The yeast is a selection of strains isolated and cross-bred from 6 yeast strains of ginjo-shu used nationwide.
The yeast is a selection of strains isolated and cross-bred from 6 yeast strains of ginjo-shu used nationwide.
The yeast is a selection of strains isolated and cross-bred from 6 yeast strains of ginjo-shu used nationwide.

sen.j: 秋田流花酵母よりもさらに華やかな日本酒香りと、日本酒香りにともなう味のふくらみが特徴。
sen.e: It features a sake aroma more glamorous than Akita-Ryu-Hanakobo, and a full flavor that comes with the sake aroma.
It features a sake aroma more glamorous than Akita-Ryu-Hanakobo, and a full flavor that comes with the sake aroma.
It features a sake aroma more glamorous than Akita-Ryu-Hanakobo, and a full flavor that comes with the sake aroma.

sen.j: 県産の酒造好適米である秋田酒こまちを用いた吟醸酒用。
sen.e: It is used for ginjo-shu made from Akita sake Komachi, which is a prefecture-grown rice suited for sake brewing.

sen.j: 吟醸酵母を親株として交雑・育種した株から選抜された。

sen.j: 香りのバランスが良く、適度な酸生成で、香味バランスが優れている。

sen.j: 酸の生成が少なく柔らかな味わいとなり、香りが高い。
sen.e: It produces little acid and has a gentle flavor and high aroma.

sen.j: 特にカプロン酸エチルの生成量がきょうかい7号の4倍にも達する。

sen.j: 醸造メーカーでは俗に蔵付酵母と呼ばれる自社（開発）酵母を保有し、使用していることが多い。
